pullRequest.body:
As shown in the new lemma `faithfulSMul_iff_algebraMap_injective`, injectivity of `algebraMap R A` is equivalent to the typeclass hypothesis `[FaithfulSMul R A]`. We thus generalise (and rename) the existing lemma `NoZeroSMulDivisors.algebraMap_injective` to `FaithfulSMul.algebraMap_injective`. The rename is responsible for much of the diff.

By weakening the assumptions `[Nontrivial A] [NoZeroSMulDivisors R A]` to just `[FaithfulSMul R A]`, results which need to use `algebraMap_injective` can be applied in that case that we have `[Ring A] [CharZero A]` but fail to have `[NoZeroSMulDivisors ‚Ñ§ A]`. This is the motivation for these changes.

There are quite a few places in the library where a lemma consumes an explicit argument of the form `Injective (algebraMap R A)`. Most / all of these should probably be restated to accept the typeclass argument `[FaithfulSMul R A]` but we do not attempt such a refactor here.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [b9227ce3e2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21287/commits/b9227ce3e243cbefc4de86ae2bcb195516d412b4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Algebra.charZero_of_charZero`
`+ FaithfulSMul.algebraMap_eq_zero_iff`
`+ FaithfulSMul.algebraMap_injective`
`+ FaithfulSMul.ker_algebraMap_eq_bot`
`+ FaithfulSMul.of_field_isFractionRing`
`+ _root_.NeZero.of_faithfulSMul`
`+ algebraMap_comp_int_cast_eq_cast`
`+ algebraMap_comp_nat_cast_eq_cast`
`+ faithfulSMul_iff_algebraMap_injective`
`+ faithfulSMul_iff_injective_smul_one`
`+ iff_faithfulSMul`
`+ instOfFaithfulSMul`
`+ instance (R : Type*) [NonAssocRing R] : FaithfulSMul R R := ‚ü®fun {r‚ÇÅ r‚ÇÇ} h ‚Ü¶ by simpa using h 1‚ü©`
`+ instance (priority := 100) (R : Type*) [Ring R] [CharZero R] : FaithfulSMul ‚Ñ§ R := by`
`+ instance (priority := 100) [CharZero R] : FaithfulSMul ‚Ñï R := by`
`+ instance (priority := 100) foo : FaithfulSMul R K`
`+ instance : FaithfulSMul (A ‚ß∏ p) (B ‚ß∏ P) := by`
`+ instance : FaithfulSMul (CyclotomicRing n A K) (CyclotomicField n K)`
`+ instance : FaithfulSMul (ùìû K) (ùìû L)`
`+ instance [Algebra R A] [FaithfulSMul R A] : FaithfulSMul R (FractionRing A) := by`
`+ instance [IsFractionRing A K] :`
`+ instance [Nontrivial A] [NoZeroSMulDivisors R A] :`
`- CyclotomicField.noZeroSMulDivisors`
`- NoZeroSMulDivisors.of_field_isFractionRing`
`- _root_.NeZero.of_noZeroSMulDivisors`
`- algebraMap_eq_zero_iff`
`- algebraMap_injective`
`- algebraMap_injective_of_liesOver`
`- iff_ker_algebraMap_eq_bot`
`- instance (priority := 100) CharZero.noZeroSMulDivisors_int [Ring R] [NoZeroDivisors R]`
`- instance (priority := 100) CharZero.noZeroSMulDivisors_nat [Semiring R] [NoZeroDivisors R]`
`- instance (priority := 100) [NoZeroDivisors K] : NoZeroSMulDivisors R K`
`- instance : NoZeroSMulDivisors (CyclotomicRing n A K) (CyclotomicField n K)`
`- instance : NoZeroSMulDivisors (ùìû K) (ùìû L)`
`- instance [Algebra R A] [NoZeroSMulDivisors R A] : NoZeroSMulDivisors R (FractionRing A) := by`
`- instance [P.IsPrime] : NoZeroSMulDivisors (A ‚ß∏ p) (B ‚ß∏ P)`
`- ker_algebraMap_eq_bot`
`- of_algebraMap_injective`
`- of_ker_algebraMap_eq_bot`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (3.00, 0.20)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|15|3|maxHeartBeats modifications|

Current commit [b9227ce3e2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/b9227ce3e243cbefc4de86ae2bcb195516d412b4)
Reference commit [c7a5e3b70e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/c7a5e3b70eb88b56993783196e1ef321435ed96c)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

pullRequest.title: feat: generalise `algebraMap_injective` by weaking its typeclass assumptions
